# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return strip(lowercase(replace(col, r"[ -]" => "_")))
end
```

This function:
- Uses `strip` to remove leading and trailing whitespace.
- Applies `lowercase` to make the entire string lowercase.
- Replaces any occurrences of space or hyphen with an underscore using `replace` with a regular expression.

Please note that in Julia, strings are immutable, so the function returns a new clean version of the column name without modifying the original input.
